results.title: Top dog = Wodzirej [NTSC]
results.brief_description: Just how far will one person go to achieve their goal? For Danielak (Jerzy Stuhr), a variety host/entertainer, there appears to be no boundaries or limits out there which will stop him from being the MC of an upcoming gala ball in a brand new hotel. Danielak is prepared to lie, deceive, bribe and bluff his way through the chain of authority in order to eliminate his competition. Realistic in style, “Top dog” is a biting commentary on 70s communist Poland, and in particular, the bureaucratic State departments and State owned companies. Director Feliks Falk is representative of the 70s new Polish cinema, the “cinema of moral anxiety” and for this, if for no other reason, “Top dog” is both intriguing and entertaining. Cast also includes Slawa Kwasniewska, Wiktor Sadecki, Michal Tarkowski, Ewa Kolasinska, Ryszard Kotys, Jerzy Kryszak. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit, Ray Barnes and Rick Reynolds
results.brief_description: Discusses the techniques of woodchopping and shows some of the top international woodchop personalities competing in the world championship held at Ulverstone, Tasmania.

results.title: Tootsie
results.creator_credit: Mirage Enterprises, Sydney Pollack and Dick Richards
results.brief_description: Nobody will hire the rash Michael Dorsey (Dustin Hoffman) because he has antagonised every producer in New York. When his girlfriend fails an audition for a soap opera; Michael dresses up as “Dorothy Michaels” and lands the part. Michael’s sole conspirators are his agent George and his room mate Geoff. All goes well until “Dorothy” falls in love with beautiful co-star Julie (Jessica Lange) - and Julie’s father falls for “Dorothy.” Co-starring Bill Murray, Teri Garr, Charles Durning and Sydney Pollack.

results.title: Toot, whistle, plunk and boom
results.brief_description: Animated cartoons show the origin and development of musical instruments. Professor Owl tells his class how all music comes from a toot (the horns), whistle (woodwinds), plunk (strings) and boom (percussion). Explains how the complex instruments of the modern symphony orchestra and brass band developed from primitive forms and the effect of various refinements such as the valves on the brass horn.

results.title: Tools of the Trade
results.credit_line:
Paint brushes

Courtesy Gary Kurzer

Scissor collection

Courtesy Edie Kurzer

Edie Kurzer, Australia, 2020
results.brief_description: Angled. Flat. Tapered. Striker. Brushes come in as many varieties as the tasks they perform on film and television sets. Whether that’s a buffer brush used to smooth the lines of an actor’s makeup, or a mop brush with a rounded edge for soft paint application on a drying prop, they are an essential, albeit overlooked, presence in moving image production. Scissors are another one of those integral items; from the different sized sewing shears used by costume cutters to the razor-sharp blades designed to cut anything from wires to duct tape, they’re an invaluable tool for crew members across every department.

constellations_other.name: Clothing, country, character
constellations_other.description: Edie Kurzer's costume design work on Judy & Punch and Picnic at Hanging Rock is part of a larger trend in Australian films and TV series.

results.title: Tools for cutting: stone axes to lasers
results.brief_description: Cutting tools, like other devices and machines, reflect industrial development. The story of tools that cut, traces technological changes in a society beginning with stone axes and proceeding to devices that cut by the use of steel, diamonds water jet, electrochemical erosion, plasma jet and laser beam.

results.title: Tools and Equipment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Selecting the correct tool for the task, inspecting the tool for damage before use, using the tool in the correct way and storing and carrying tools safely may all seem fairly obvious. These four basic rules for safe use of tools are straightforward but are often abused. This video looks at each of the basic rules and it also examines the safe use of ladders.

results.title: Tool steel manufacture
results.brief_description: Filmed at the works of Adcar Allen and Co Ltd, Sheffield. Shows the making of genuine double shear steel - the oldest Sheffield process. Includes pattern making (moulding by hand and machine); machining steel castings; tramway and railway trackwork.

results.title: Too old? Never
results.creator_credit: Summer Hill Films and Council on the Ageing (NSW)
results.brief_description: Sylvia feels invisible because a taxi driver treats her with condescension and takes the long route home despite her protests. She tells her friend Isobel, who encourages her to attend an information session about anti-discrimination legislation. There she meets Douglas, who has lodged a formal complaint to the Anti-Discrimination Board because he feels he is a victim of age discrimination in his workplace. Sylvia offers to be a support for Douglas when he must attend a mediation session with his team leader and the Board. Compromises are met and friendships are created in this informative short film. An ideal training tool for the workplace, classroom or discussion group.
